title: Unexpected panic in compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I got a an unexpected panic when running `cargo build` on a project using the latest stable version of Rust 1.58.1. ### Code I don't have time right nor a good lead for minimizing the code example for now, but may try to do so later. Sorry about that. For the time being, the offending commit is [b13930e1f948b2773f1049fc4724e45306f6f175](https://github.com/tweag/nickel/tree/b13930e1f948b2773f1049fc4724e45306f6f175) on [tweag/nickel](https://github.com/tweag/nickel/). The error is triggered by a `cargo build` at the root of the project. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.58.1 (db9d1b20b 2022-01-20) binary: rustc commit-hash: db9d1b20bba1968c1ec1fc49616d4742c1725b4b commit-date: 2022-01-20 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.58.1 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/db9d1b20bba1968c1ec1fc49616d4742c1725b4b/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14 error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.58.1 (db9d1b20b 2022-01-20) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
Backtrace
